name: Northern Snail-seed Pondweed

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: slender, profusely branching, slightly compressed in cross-section

Leaves: light green to golden, two types: submersed – entire, narrow strap-shaped (1-8cm long, 0.5-2mm wide), rounded at tip, slightly curled, no petiole, alternately arranged in spirals, translucent bands on both sides of midvein, stipules fused; floating – small (0.7-3.5cm long), oval on slender petioles
Fruits/Seeds: midsummer, look flattened, faintly spiral disks, tiny in clusters in leaf axils or on ends of thread-like stalks
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northeast and north central United States

tags: plants with blade-shaped leaves on stems
fine slender leaves - not arranged in whorls
